jobTitle: Business Analytics Manager-Global Business Operations Control Center
jobDescription: Are you innately curious, passionate about building impactful operations and a truth seeker using data? Splunk is looking for a Business Analytics Manager to join its dynamic Global Business Operations (GBO) team to boost Spunk’s fast growing business. The GBO team ensures data driven decision-making and operations scaling throughout the company. As a member of the team, you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses quantitative methods to get things done. And most importantly, you are an individual who wonders "What if?" And are relentless in seeking out the solution. This individual will play a key role in how we “bring data to everything” with expertise and passion to help scale Splunk teams and the business across the globe. The individual's knowledge of data, will enable in providing impactful analysis to ensure our GBO organization and Business Leaders are well-informed and able to make thoughtful, data backed decisions. Responsibilities I Want To And Can Do That Work with business to define critical KPIs and metrics, to support cross-functional teams manage performance and create operational rigor Create processes and lead data team to build data visualization, as well as providing ongoing enhancements to existing business dashboards Oversee all aspects of lifecycle - design, development and delivery by working with in-house development and IT organization Partner with technical teams to build scalable data architecture to support reporting, visualization, dashboard and tools development Develop insights through reports, dashboards and advanced analytics and build narratives and strategic recommendations to support key decision-making Conduct in-depth analyses and build statistical models to identify trends and key drivers that inform important decisions across the business Build a roadmap and vision for Business Insights, data and related tools strategy Leada a data analytics team Requirements I’ve already done that or have that! Minimum of 12 years of related experience including some management/leading team experience possibly analytics teams bringing data to decision making Stong analytical and problem-solving experience, handle unforeseen issues, exposure to large-scale systems and experience in coding Deep understanding of complex data models, BI methodologies, Data Architecture principals, Master data and metadata Understanding of operational processes, systems and data in multiple areas of Sales & operations; Forecasting, Pipeline management, Account management, Sales performance etc. Entrepreneurial self-starter. Thrive in a fast paced environment and am independently capable of seeking information, corralling resources, and delivering results without waiting for direction Thrive on combining rigorous data-driven analysis, strong business and product judgment, and an ability to work well across teams Comfortable handling sometimes ambiguously-defined problems, developing creative solutions and delivering against aggressive timelines Education Got it! B. S. or M.S. in a quantitative field, such as Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, and Computer Science Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $ 152,000 - 209,000 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $ 142,400 - 195,800 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $ 129,600 - 178,200 per year We value diversity at our company. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, arrest and conviction records will not disqualify you from consideration.

Role As a Business Value Advisor, you will develop and implement strategies that build pipeline opportunities, drive growth, and improve efficiencies within your assigned sales district. You will work with the sales management teams to develop account strategies and assist in determining multi-year plans to expand Splunk's portfolio across the key buying centers and into the lines of business. Strategic priorities and execution will be governed by the customer’s business imperatives and mapped to Splunk's capabilities across the portfolio to meet and exceed desired outcomes. You will partner with our sales leaders to drive the operational cadence, consult on critical accounts and opportunities, and help with preparation of content to include sales campaigns, deal framing, pricing structure, and negotiation strategies. Responsibilities Work in conjunction with sales and account leadership with the framing of a deal “psychology” and the development of an expansion roadmap to grow yearly incremental revenue Develop and deliver a value hypothesis Customer-centric value alignment, definition, and creation Develop and position account-level innovative programs Build an economic foundation and help coordinate activity toward the support of a business case Assist in the creation of proposals Support C-level meetings Participate in deal strategy, planning, and review Attend Sales Leadership forecast calls Help our customers rationalize and justify their Splunk investment as a means of achieving their strategic business objectives. Alignment of customer business challenges, requirements, initiatives and targets Influencing and partnering with key resources to drive business transformation, define a business value expression (story, calculations, charts, points, etc.) Helping key resources justify Splunk annual expenditures Requirements Minimum of 15 years of experience selling enterprise software solutions. Selling SaaS is strongly preferred. Success with the development & refinement of multi-year adoption strategies & cases that support digital ground-breaking business imperatives. Helped close 7 & 8-figure software sales/SaaS type deals We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Splunk is the world’s first Data-to-Everything Platform. Now organizations no longer need to worry about where their data is coming from, and they are free to focus on the business outcomes that data can deliver. Role Are you passionate about customer success and big data? Are you a true hybrid professional with customer acumen and a proven technical foundation? Then come be a member of Splunk Customer Success, providing mentorship, planning and oversight while demonstrating adoption and technical best practices. The Customer Success Manager (CSM) is the key partner helping our valued customers achieve their strategic objectives and maximum value from their investment in Splunk. Additionally, the CSM serves as the liaison between the customer and the Splunk ecosystem, streamlining partnership with Product Management, Engineering, Professional Services, Education, and others. Responsibilities Develop strong overall relationships internally within the business and external with assigned clients; with a focus on driving adoption, ensuring retention, and happiness. Work with clients to build Customer Success Plans, establishing critical goals, to aid the customer in achieving their objectives. Measure and monitor customer’s achievement of critical and key performance indicators, reporting both internally to Splunk Account team and externally to Customer Sponsors and Executives. Establish regular cadence (Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly) with each assigned client, to review executive dashboards, and program status. Cement yourself as a trusted/strategic advisor with customers and drive continued value of our products and services. Work closely with the Splunk Account Team (Account Manager, SE, PS and EDU) to find opportunities for new usage of Splunk across organizational functions. Experience leveraging a connected team to help customers success, to include partnering with organizations such as renewals, business value, specialists, and other field support organizations Work to identify and/or develop upsell opportunities. Advocate customer needs/issues cross-departmentally and program-manage customer concerns. Assist in workshops to help customers demonstrate the full value of Splunk solutions and lead periodic partner meetings. Provide insight with respect to the availability and applicability of new products and features. Support Professional Services with scoping, and selling follow-on and new service opportunities. Support Education Services in identifying and recommending staff training opportunities. Identify in cooperation with the Account team the key success criteria for Splunk deployment and drive customer value. Cultivate customer champions, technical and executive, that will be responsible for successful implementation of the product. Act as the Splunk liaison for Splunk technical inquiries, issues or escalations. This will include working with Splunk Support, Product Management (i.e. roadmaps), or others as needed. Maintain current functional and technical knowledge of the Splunk platform and future products. Requirements Minimum of 9 years in a related function with direct customer advocacy and engagement experience in post-sales or professional services functions; Federal experience and clearance required Since this role is essential to Splunk's customer success initiative, you will have a rich history of growing customer satisfaction, adoption, and retention. Prior experience in IT operations, security, and/or cloud is desired Confirmed ability to drive continuous product value. Experience listening to customers, clearing obstacles, and developing product use-cases. You will be a strong teammate, but still a self-starter capable of working independently Since this role is customer facing, you will possess exceptional verbal, written, social, presentation, and interpersonal skills. Thrives in a multi-tasking environment and can adjust priorities on-the-fly while still having the ability to focus on details and be analytical. Good technical and problem solving skills coupled with the ability to provide quick resolution to problems. Prior experience conducting workshops to customers and discussing pros and cons of implementing various technologies and business value. Experience navigating and steering customer engagements to completion with a high level of customer happiness. This position is based remotely - but as it is customer facing, CSMs should be willing to travel up to 50% (estimated average 25%). Since travel is based on customer and business needs there may be more or less travel depending on location of customers. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

jobTitle: Director, AMER & PBST Deal Strategy & Execution (US REMOTE)
jobDescription: Role We are looking for a gifted communicator and business executive who can build consensus and motivate sales teams and customers to succeed. Leading a team of professionals consisting of deal strategists, contract negotiators, and business practices specialists, you will have an opportunity to influence and provide strategic guidance to field sales leadership, as well as various other business functions within Splunk (finance, legal, quoting operations, etc.). Lastly, you are a confident enterprising person that exhibits tact and persistence and brings dedication to the team. Responsibilities You will lead a team responsible for Contracting (field education, field strategy, terms, negotiation), Deal Framework (field education, deal structure, revenue implications, customer negotiations, customer term, Order Document drafting) and Value Selling (RFx response, Go/No Go determination). In leading this team, you will be responsible for influencing the sales teams (leaders and contributors) while maintaining strong relationships with legal, revenue recognition and finance. Additional responsibilities will include Partner with the AMER & PBST General Manager as a trusted advisor and act as a single point of contact for sales facing deal strategy and execution support, including orchestration and remediation of all In-theater escalations Create value and expediency for the field by serving as a Subject Matter Expert and coordination channel with corporate support organizations such as product management, legal and finance Demonstrate creativity and determination to drive complex opportunities and increase overall sales productivity Provide strategic mentorship and influence to sales leadership while driving adherence to established ethical, business, legal and financial principles Negotiate favorable pricing and business terms with large, complex organizations balancing customer needs while being mindful of Splunk’s interests Be a good corporate citizen – two-way flow of significant and timely information; work as a team for the most efficient use and deployment of resources Provide timely and insightful input back to other corporate functions Partner with Global Field Enablement to advise and train the field on strategic use of contracting terms that lead to swift and effective structuring of cloud Software as a Service (SaaS) deals Act as a thought leader and take ownership in development of programs contributing to global organizational advancement Create unification within the organization with team calls, one-to-one’s and employee reviews Develop and rollout proactive approach to supporting sales for the organization Requirements 10+ years experience in Best Practices, Deal Desk, Legal or equivalent, and influencing a sales team (leaders and individuals) on contract negotiations, successful sales practices, sophisticated selling, and ability to show value 5+ years experience building, running or serving as a key support stakeholder to front line sales facing teams; ability to grow and scale upward with the company; second line management experience a plus 5+ years experience with Public Sector sales or sales management experience including working with all types of partners, including resellers, distributors and system integrators Experience selling enterprise software preferred Successful experience and very comfortable in the “C” suite with a track record of negotiating six and seven figure software licensing transactions—going on sales calls w/sales reps, running calls. Subject matter expert with strong understanding of legal and contractual terms in licensing, SaaS and cloud-based subscription contracting Strong executive presence with the ability to negotiate at the executive level Stakeholder management skills, ability to create collaborative and trusted relationships in a complex matrixed and cross-functional organization Ability to coach and develop peers and leaders alike; serve as a strong manager who can develop a high-functioning team Demonstrated capabilities in leadership, management, collaboration, partnership Strong social, written and presentation skills Ability to work effectively in an unstructured environment requiring new perspectives and creative approaches, and with multiple competing deadlines. Can adapt quickly to changes and possesses strong work ethic Ability to be highly productive with minimal oversight from senior management Thrives in a dynamic, fast-growing, rapidly growing environment Strong stakeholder management skills, ability to create collaborative and trusted relationships in a complex matrixed and cross-functional organization

work as a team for the most efficient use and deployment of resources Provide timely and insightful input back to other corporate functions Partner with Global Field Enablement to advise and train the field on strategic use of contracting terms that lead to swift and effective structuring of cloud Software as a Service (SaaS) deals Act as a thought leader and take ownership in development of programs contributing to global organizational advancement Create unification within the organization with team calls, one-to-one’s and employee reviews Develop and rollout proactive approach to supporting sales for the organization Requirements 10+ years experience in Best Practices, Deal Desk, Legal or equivalent, and influencing a sales team (leaders and individuals) on contract negotiations, successful sales practices, sophisticated selling, and ability to show value 5+ years experience building, running or serving as a key support stakeholder to front line sales facing teams; ability to grow and scale upward with the company; second line management experience a plus 5+ years experience with Public Sector sales or sales management experience including working with all types of partners, including resellers, distributors and system integrators Experience selling enterprise software preferred Successful experience and very comfortable in the “C” suite with a track record of negotiating six and seven figure software licensing transactions—going on sales calls w/sales reps, running calls. Subject matter expert with strong understanding of legal and contractual terms in licensing, SaaS and cloud-based subscription contracting Strong executive presence with the ability to negotiate at the executive level Stakeholder management skills, ability to create collaborative and trusted relationships in a complex matrixed and cross-functional organization Ability to coach and develop peers and leaders alike; serve as a strong manager who can develop a high-functioning team Demonstrated capabilities in leadership, management, collaboration, partnership Strong social, written and presentation skills Ability to work effectively in an unstructured environment requiring new perspectives and creative approaches, and with multiple competing deadlines. Can adapt quickly to changes and possesses strong work ethic Ability to be highly productive with minimal oversight from senior management Thrives in a dynamic, fast-growing, rapidly growing environment Strong stakeholder management skills, ability to create collaborative and trusted relationships in a complex matrixed and cross-functional organization

jobTitle: Director of Applied Machine Learning Experiences
jobDescription: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun, and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! The Machine Learning team is building a new platform called Sparta and this platform will be used to build assistive intelligence experiences (AIEs). These AIEs enable Splunk customers to accomplish their tasks while using real-time user feedback to build self-tuning cloud services. The focus of the selected candidate will be to manage the AIE portfolio and automate simple tasks and processes by harnessing the power of Big Data, cloud, and data science to aid in actionable decision-making and system remediation. Create the capability to make intelligent recommendations, detect anomalies, and help users prioritize events and alerts. Create libraries, services, and SDK to accelerate AIE development. Lead a team of engineers and researchers that collaborate with product and applied research teams to build ML features into a wide variety of products across Splunk. Recruit, mentor, and grow world class engineers and managers Partner with cross functional team members to develop and maintain a well-defined roadmap, while balancing technological excellence. Manage the AIE portfolio (the assistive intelligence experiences) Help define technical direction and architecture with engineering team members. Facilitate coordination of multiple scrum teams to successfully deliver committed feature sets. Drive practices in training and development, and drive efficiencies across multiple feature teams. Build a culture of continuous learning, growth, and sharing of technological insights. Requirements 10+ years of hands-on technical experience. 4+ years of direct management experience of highly technical managers and engineers. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or another quantitative field. We will consider equivalent practical experience Experience in delivering multiple complex technical projects within an Agile environment. Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Familiar with machine learning and data science workflows. Expertise in developing software on a public cloud platform (AWS, GCP, Azure). Expertise in developing software with stream processing technology (Kafka, AWS Kinesis). Proficiency with backend systems built using microservices, containerized infrastructure, and modern continuous delivery practices. Demonstrated ability to build a culture of team building and people management. Demonstrated ability to reach stretch goals in a fast-paced environment Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

jobTitle: Director of Targeted Pipeline - Individual Contributor - REMOTE
jobDescription: Responsibilities Drive program management for strategic (targeted) pipeline covering generation, acceleration and closure and monitoring program success across all Splunk theaters (regions) WW. This includes collaboration with Sales Operations, Finance, Sales leaders and stakeholders for accurate and timely reporting Strong understanding of SaaS models and Cloud strategies of Customer’s digital transformation Partner with Sales Leadership and other cross-functional teams in theaters to identify pipeline gaps and gain insights to advise and prioritize existing and future pipeline program development focus areas Orchestrate pipeline program planning from inception to completion, ensuring that business partners understand scope, roles, responsibilities, and key due dates. Establish key performance indicators to track pipeline programs efficacy; must be hands-on comfortable with Data analytics, Reporting tools (SFDC, Tableau..). Day to day responsibilities will include working closely with sales leadership to understand the quality of the pipeline, and how to progress the pipe through prescriptive sales plays. Also working with cross-functional teams to develop and maintain important metrics, dashboards, and reporting to make recommendations on pipeline monitoring & improvements Requirements 8+ years of GTM operations, executive reporting / analytics, experience in a fast growing software/SaaS organization Critical thinking, outstanding writing and editing, impeccable planning and polished relationship-building skills Demonstrated experience managing complex program design, development, and deployment successfully with measurable results at a mid to large size tech company Operational skills with ability to collaborate in building scalable, repeatable programs Program / Project management and/or change management skills (PMI or PROSCI certified a plus) with experience working with a sales ecosystem. Outstanding ability to see the big picture and provide frameworks for execution at a more granular level. Ability to represent concepts, vision and objectives and communicate across organizations and business partners supporting critical pipeline monitoring work streams Well-organized; able to manage multiple tasks and results at one time, and prioritize in a high-pressure often changing environment Collaborative and agile working style with success networking and building relationships to support cross team engagement and alignment Tenacious, persistent and employs a “can do” attitude Excellent communication and written skills Knowledge of IT markets specifically, Cloud transformation and DX strategies of customers is a big plus. Experience working with SFDC, Tableau, Data analytics or similar BI/Data warehousing platforms a plus. Experience working with G-suite GTM Transformation and Frameworks is desired Previous sales (quota carrying) or sales support experience a plus We are open to candidates anywhere in the U.S. Fun people are required Individual contributor role but able to influence leadership We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $ 184,000 - 253,000 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $ 172,800 - 237,600 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $ 156,800 - 215,600 per year

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Do you thrive on seeing customers happy? Do you possess the ability to develop processes and technical pre-sales skills needed to deliver positive outcomes in the area of Observability ? If so, and you're passionate about owning the overall success of our Observability Consulting Engineer and Architect team globally, then this role may be for you. Our Director, Technical Interlock Leader works alongside the wider Sales and Sales Engineering Leadership teams and various Observability Market stakeholders, including the AVP of Observability Market Group Customer Success, and the GVP Global Observability Markets Specialization, to ensure SE/CE readiness, strategies, and field execution is consistently aligned with our customer needs and corporate strategy. You will be the main consultative resource guiding the Observability CE team, ensuring accountability and execution for Observability pre-sales across the Sales Engineering organization. You will drive performance across our global Observability Consulting Engineer and Architects team by aligning this team with our Corporate, Sales, Enablement, and Observability Markets Group Strategies. In this critical role, you will ensure the Sales Engineering organization is enabled and delivering technical solutioning to customers, continually monitor and growing CE expert skills, development, and performance, while driving customer success and providing critical technology feedback into the factory when areas for improvement become apparent. Responsibilities As an integral part of the Sales Engineering leadership team, you will be accountable for successful Observability technical interlock and execution for Splunk’s pre-sales field team. Owns prioritization, strategy, performance, and development of the Observability Markets Group practice across the Sales Engineering org. Partners with the Observability Market Group Customer Success Leader, Observability Strategists, Field PMs, and Technical Enablement teams to drive continuous field improvement. Ensure the CE engagement model is performing optimally in support of the Observability Markets Group priorities and Sales targets. Define and iterate processes and procedures for developing economies of scale across the global Observability Consulting Engineers team. Lead the effort to build high impact communications and collateral delivering scalable success. Ensure Observability Markets expertise and capability across SE (technical readiness), providing recommendations to leadership on resourcing, direction, and technical development to move the Observability Consulting Engineering team forward. Shape customer expectations and thoroughly align outcomes with customer requirements while focusing on business value. Lead a matrixed team across Pre-Sales functions to achieve the aforementioned goals. Provide input into the Field PM organization to influence the technical priorities of our product roadmap. Define the path to success and influence others, in Customer Success, the Observability Markets Group, and the Sales team to achieve and exceed their performance goals. Requirements 10+ years of Pre-Sales experience selling and/or delivering Security solutions to customers globally. Firm understanding of pre-sales business priorities and practices in Sales Engineering with a strong preference given to those leading a specialized/overlay function Comfortable leading change, developing processes, implementing procedures and working cross-functionally to achieve desired outcomes. Although this role is strategic in nature, you need to have the ability to roll up your sleeves to get things done without explicit direction. Experience leading technical experts and influencing pre-sales leadership. Ability to work across the Pre-Sales organization in a positive and effective manner to drive Observability Markets Group execution. Deep understanding of Observability Markets software solutions Proven experience developing and enabling engagement plans and achieving outcomes (right people, right goal, right numbers). Willing to work as part of a diverse team, taking mentorship from multiple partners to achieve desired outcomes. Able to travel 50% globally (more during peak times) BA/BS preferred in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Business or equivalent work experience preferred. MBA/MS a strong plus. We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $212,000 - 291,500 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $199,200 - 273,900 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $188,000 - 258,500 per year

If so, and you're passionate about owning the overall success of our Observability Consulting Engineer and Architect team globally, then this role may be for you. Our Director, Technical Interlock Leader works alongside the wider Sales and Sales Engineering Leadership teams and various Observability Market stakeholders, including the AVP of Observability Market Group Customer Success, and the GVP Global Observability Markets Specialization, to ensure SE/CE readiness, strategies, and field execution is consistently aligned with our customer needs and corporate strategy. You will be the main consultative resource guiding the Observability CE team, ensuring accountability and execution for Observability pre-sales across the Sales Engineering organization. You will drive performance across our global Observability Consulting Engineer and Architects team by aligning this team with our Corporate, Sales, Enablement, and Observability Markets Group Strategies. In this critical role, you will ensure the Sales Engineering organization is enabled and delivering technical solutioning to customers, continually monitor and growing CE expert skills, development, and performance, while driving customer success and providing critical technology feedback into the factory when areas for improvement become apparent. Responsibilities As an integral part of the Sales Engineering leadership team, you will be accountable for successful Observability technical interlock and execution for Splunk’s pre-sales field team. Owns prioritization, strategy, performance, and development of the Observability Markets Group practice across the Sales Engineering org. Partners with the Observability Market Group Customer Success Leader, Observability Strategists, Field PMs, and Technical Enablement teams to drive continuous field improvement. Ensure the CE engagement model is performing optimally in support of the Observability Markets Group priorities and Sales targets. Define and iterate processes and procedures for developing economies of scale across the global Observability Consulting Engineers team. Lead the effort to build high impact communications and collateral delivering scalable success. Ensure Observability Markets expertise and capability across SE (technical readiness), providing recommendations to leadership on resourcing, direction, and technical development to move the Observability Consulting Engineering team forward. Shape customer expectations and thoroughly align outcomes with customer requirements while focusing on business value. Lead a matrixed team across Pre-Sales functions to achieve the aforementioned goals. Provide input into the Field PM organization to influence the technical priorities of our product roadmap. Define the path to success and influence others, in Customer Success, the Observability Markets Group, and the Sales team to achieve and exceed their performance goals. Requirements 10+ years of Pre-Sales experience selling and/or delivering Security solutions to customers globally. Firm understanding of pre-sales business priorities and practices in Sales Engineering with a strong preference given to those leading a specialized/overlay function Comfortable leading change, developing processes, implementing procedures and working cross-functionally to achieve desired outcomes. Although this role is strategic in nature, you need to have the ability to roll up your sleeves to get things done without explicit direction. Experience leading technical experts and influencing pre-sales leadership. Ability to work across the Pre-Sales organization in a positive and effective manner to drive Observability Markets Group execution. Deep understanding of Observability Markets software solutions Proven experience developing and enabling engagement plans and achieving outcomes (right people, right goal, right numbers). Willing to work as part of a diverse team, taking mentorship from multiple partners to achieve desired outcomes. Able to travel 50% globally (more during peak times) BA/BS preferred in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Business or equivalent work experience preferred. MBA/MS a strong plus. We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $212,000 - 291,500 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $199,200 - 273,900 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $188,000 - 258,500 per year

Join us as we pursue our innovative new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Splunk is the world’s first Data-to-Everything Platform. Now organizations no longer need to worry about where their data is coming from, and they are free to focus on the business outcomes that data can deliver. What you get from this role Our Business Development teams partner with all sales theaters to bring Splunk solutions to the most ground-breaking companies in the world. A career at Splunk means challenging yourself and your customers to reach higher - and to have fun doing it. We are seeking a dynamic, early career professional to join our fast-growing team. There is a defined growth path for successful Inside Sales Representatives to be promoted throughout the sales organization and other similar roles and marketing functions. What Your Day To Day Responsibilities Look Like In this role, you will showcase the ability to focus on an organization’s initiatives, challenges, pain points and partner with Splunk Field Sales to bring value to those organizations through our sales process. You will Create pipeline for your accounts using demand generation and prospecting tools Find new opportunities and quickly develop rapport with new clients Explore & identify new opportunities in new accounts and/or buying centers Research and present business intelligence about customers and prospects Generate business opportunities through professional networking and cold-calling You’ll be driving sales activities on highly strategic accounts and projects within an ecosystem of best-in-class sales, technical and operational partners. Successful team members develop and demonstrate their sales acuity and move on to other sales positions and other roles. Who you are Sales hunter Tenacious Confident Competitive Persistent Ambitious Strategic Self-disciplined In order to be successful in this role, we are looking for a rep who has At least 1 year of experience in selling or generating demand for enterprise IT solutions (BI, data analytics, security software, risk management software or networking performance) Determination & relishes the chase Self-motivation and steadfast in pursuit of creating their own success To be at the top of the leaderboard & hates to lose High energy and contagious optimism A tendency to lead conversations & is assertive with next steps Adaptability and thrives on environments where they can grow Confidence in handling of objections and conflict Logic-based problem solving Task prioritization, discipline, and accountability A passion for research, data, and analysis that drives action Keen situational awareness within a team environment An ability to analyze business data to tell a compelling and actionable story Excellent presentation skills and clear communication An instinct to Google a solution to a new problem A strong executive presence, with polish and dedication to customer outcomes We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers. We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Role Are you passionate about creating GTM strategy, growing strategic partnerships, and driving partner sales execution? Splunk is looking for a ISV partnership leader, who is inventive and results driven, to help take Splunk’s strategic partnership with SAP to the next level. You show expertise in indirect sales channels, have deep knowledge of the software and cloud solutions, and possess practical knowledge of SAP. You know how to effectively grow business relationships to increase sales activity while thinking strategically about new multi-channel sales motions. You will help Splunk build and implement compelling GTM plans that deliver value to our customers, prospects, and our partners. In this role, you will be responsible for building the global GTM strategy and associated sales execution for Splunk’s partnership with SAP. Success will depend on your ability to balance strategic-thinking with methodical execution; build effective and enduring relationships; drive highly cross-functional processes; and blend product and industry expertise with a pragmatic focus on tangible outcomes. Responsibilities Work closely with the Global ISV Leader and align with the all-up alliance strategy for the SAP partnership Get results within established sales motions and create new GTM partnership plans with SAP. This includes solution management, sales strategy, and field execution by aligning across GTM functions Engage with Splunk + SAP Sales Executives to successfully launch offerings through co-selling motions Grow solution exposure and create sales plays that enhance direct and indirect sales opportunity (Splunk, SAP and SI/MSP/Channel partners) Play "quarterback" to lead creation of GTM activity to drive consistency and scale across Splunk's primary global sales theaters. It is critical that this role drives both internal and external sales prioritization to hit our shared revenue metrics and goals Expand executive relationships across SAP’ Sales organization. Make recommendations and quickly build consensus across senior level Partner Executives Working with Partner Marketing, develop SAP/Splunk collateral and resources that can be used for both internal/sales enablement as well as for end-customers Support SAP/Splunk regional events including SAP Summits, SplunkLive, Technical Symposiums, SKO’s, etc., and how each will be optimized globally Define how Splunk will operate within and leverage SAP partner programs to improve sales opportunity Requirements 10+ years of experience within Software and/or SaaS companies running Global Alliance Partnerships. Experience leading SAP is preferred Experience in thought leadership in partnerships, business development, solution selling, marketing, and partner relationship management Experience working within diverse indirect partner sales channels; SI, MSP CSP Experience driving alliance partner relationships across a range of business activities (engineering/product alignment, joint solution development, marketing, training, and sales engagement) Strong executive presence, including communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort to both large and small customers. Extensive experience running virtual teams across functions and geographies Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think strategically and creatively about business problems. Ability to work towards business outcomes dedicatedly and collaboratively. Does not shy away from performing the strategy “hands on” Ability to embrace change, drive business processes, and contribute to the overall success of Splunk Travel up to 25% We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus or commission and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Bas e Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $159,600 - 219,450 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), New York (excludes NYC Metro Area), and all other states. Base Pay Range $156,800 - 215,600 per year

Role The Global Partner Organization (GPO) plays a meaningful role in Splunk’s cloud growth and digital transformation with customers. The Head of Programs & Strategy is responsible for driving the strategy to modernize the partner program and build a holistic approach to working across multiple partner business models for ecosystem success with our customers. Our mission is to accelerate Partner success in the market through people, programs, investments, and campaigns across the partner lifecycle. This senior leader will work closely with marketing, communications, and field teams to map out and oversee all external industry, community, and press engagements to drive Splunk’s brand, its customer imperatives, and its pipeline. Responsibilities The GPO is hiring for a senior leader responsible to manage a team who will play an instrumental role in delivering the modernization of partner program, experience and engagements via the execution of the following strategic priorities Build and modernize partner experience, implementing a comprehensive co-sell strategy to accelerate our transformation to solution selling including Partner Co-Sell Programs strategy and execution of Partnerverse. Expand new business models and support the strategy and execution, including program governance across functional teams at Splunk to ensure we achieve breakthroughs in rapidly growing capacity through recruit & activation of broader partner ecosystem to activate and grow profitable business practices Leadership and execution of the partner programs for MSSP, CSP, GSI, ISV and other new and emerging channels Programmatic GTM strategy definition and execution to accelerate and improve impact of how we take the best partner solutions to market and sell together including Engagement framework for predictable and effective joint Co-Marketing and Co-Sell with top partners across the solution areas and partner types. Programs execution overseeing across functional leadership for broad approach from lead generation, pipeline acceleration; events integration, communications, PR and onboarding and activation. Build digital strategy to support ongoing growth of partner ecosystem, advocacy, portal and intersection of marketing and enablement for unified approach with the partner. Experience Required 15+ years of experience in product or channel marketing, partner channel development, business development, through partner marketing, in the IT industry Proven track record and experience in partner sales & marketing programs, strategy and execution. Proven management experience in leading, developing, and motivating team members Past experience identifying strategic partner alignment and partner program gaps and collaborating with owners and stakeholders to improve partner engagement in cloud opportunities. Critical thinking with demonstrated creative problem solving of sophisticated business issues through analytics, data driven insights, organizational skills, and good judgment Inclusive and collaborative – driving teamwork and cross-team alignment Demonstrated ability to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously and drive goals to completion. Possess decision-making, creative problem solving, and negotiation skills. Have an ability to keep pace in a rapidly changing environment, which requires prioritization, constant learning, prioritizing multiple responsibilities at once, and taking calculated risks. Skilled at business planning and diligent at measuring and communicating progress towards the plan, identifying roadblocks, and coming up with appropriate solutions. Strong executive presence including communication and presentation skills Experience with technology platforms and solutions with a reasonable level of technical proficiency across cloud capabilities. Bachelor degree required (Sales, Marketing, Business Operations); MBA desired We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. jobTitle: Managed Service Provider GTM Strategy Specialist
jobDescription: Role Splunk is looking for a creative, upbeat Leader to join our team as a Managed Service Provider GTM Strategy Specialist. In this role, you will help define and drive Splunk’s strategy for Managed Service Providers' route-to-market. MSP's are a key part of the Splunk Global partner organization accountable for driving a world class team of partner managers and passionate about equipping, enabling and empowering our SP partners to embed the Splunk platform across their catalog of service offerings to rapidly increase growth. You will champion, influence, align, implement and govern global program strategy & execution, as well as own and run initiatives to scale MSP business. Responsibilities Providing the GTM Strategy leadership and direction for a cross-organizational team of Splunkers including partner managers, Service Provider (SP) Specialists, Partner Technical Managers and Field sales to meet and exceed annual ACV targets. Build, develop and establish a broader route-to-market model, and drive program improvements to support, Cloud-native partners, while supporting traditional SP partners through their evolution to Cloud. Develop global operating model principles, initiatives and programs to ensure Route-to-Market (RTM) Alignment & Governance. Lead the collaboration of “deal level” strategies & tactics, supporting Splunk’s regional PMs and sales teams to land new, or expand existing service offerings with SP partners. Includes ability to comfortably step in to negotiate license and agreement terms as the Global Leader on behalf of Splunk Work on problems/projects of diverse complexity and scope. Ability to act as a functional manager – Leading teams in order to drive Splunk sales opportunities into traditional and Cloud-native SPs Requirements 10+ years of prior global alliances and channel sales experience, including business development leadership experience in Enterprise Software and/or Cloud Services. Intimate understanding of the broad software ecosystem and modern Cloud strategies around Software Development architectures, SaaS, etc. Proven skills building GTM pans for SPs and partner organizations. Strong ability for negotiating complex legal agreements with service providers that have delivered multi-million dollar annual recurring revenue streams for software/SaaS companies Successful proven experience working with the strategic systems integrators and SPs that use embedded software or SaaS platforms in their Service Offerings. Strong preference for experience and relationships with Cloud and SaaS Service Providers. Capability to develop knowledge of client's business, organizational structure, business processes and financial structure. Strong executive presence, including communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort to both large and small customers. History of growing revenue, or exceeding quota, applicable to the partner program and reputation from partners to back it up. You are a collaborative team mate and goal-oriented, with proficiency and desire to build consensus and resolve conflict in a collaborative manner. Bachelor's degree preferred and MBA a plus This is an individual contributor role We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you’re looking to drive impact with partners on a growing Global Partner Marketing team, then look no further. Splunk is seeking a Manager, Global Partner Marketing to help deliver strategic Partner Marketing campaigns that cross multiple channels, and complete tactics required to increase engagement with Splunk partners globally. An ability to craft messaging and campaigns by use case will be important in addition to working cross functionally with the integrated campaigns team. This role will report to the Director of Global Strategic Partner Marketing and will work across the marketing and partner organizations to successfully implement, execute, and iterate global campaigns such as building end-to-end GTM strategies and constructing partner horizontal campaigns to drive scale with Splunk’s partner ecosystem. The candidate will be an experienced self-starter, excel at time management, able to prioritize and manage multiple deadlines, highly organized, and can drive consensus across many groups and collaborators. The candidate earns trust through relationship building and thinks both strategically and analytically on how to improve / solve areas of opportunities within the organization. Responsibilities The primary pillars to this role include strategic partner marketing, campaign development, relationship building, communication, and leadership . Campaign Management Build campaign plans, establish messaging including value propositions, and ensure the timely delivery of project milestones and deliverables. Cross-functional Collaboration and Alignment Partner closely with Regional Marketing, Partner Programs, Product Marketing, Training and Sales Enablement, Events, Corporate Communications, and more. Budget & Agency Management Oversee required budget and agency(ies) needed to build and execute global partner marketing engagement program deliverables. Performance Metrics Collaborate with leadership to establish the best metrics and targets to measure engagement program health / effectiveness, work with the right teams to gather the data, assess metrics on a regular basis and adjust plans as necessary. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 9+ years of related experience, preferably in a marketing program and project management discipline Experience working with multiple partner types (i.e., VARS, SI, CSP, MSP, ISV, etc.) Successful track record leading multiple program initiatives simultaneously Experience managing third-party agencies to execute marketing assets & deliverables Effective project management skills Strong written/verbal communication and presentation skills. Strong interpersonal skills and ability to gain respect of senior management and executives. Willingness to travel (20-25%) for global program execution - travel may flux depending on Splunk’s COVID policy We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Splunk is the world’s first Data-to-Everything Platform. Now organizations no longer need to worry about where their data is coming from, and they are free to focus on the business outcomes that data can deliver. Role Are you passionate about customer success and big data? Are you an observability/monitoring professional or site reliability engineer with customer acumen and a proven technical foundation? Then come be a member of Splunk Customer Success, providing mentorship, planning and oversight while demonstrating adoption and technical best practices. The Observability Customer Success Manager (CSE) is the key partner helping our valued customers achieve their strategic objectives and maximum value from their investment in Splunk. Additionally, the Observability CSE serves as the liaison between the customer and the Splunk ecosystem, streamlining partnership with Product Management, Engineering, Professional Services, Education, and others. Responsibilities I Want To and Can Do That! Lead relationship with assigned client’s observability teams, which includes managing on-boarding, implementation, training, increasing adoption, ensuring retention, and high levels of customer satisfaction Establish a trusted and strategic advisor relationship to help drive continued value of our products and services Maintain existing customer success metrics and data as directed Partner with account Customer Success Managers (CSM’s) as the Splunk Observability product-area subject matter/product-specific technical customer advisor to assist customer in the design, build, and establishment of an adoption plan and continuous adoption process Serve as day-to-day contact for assigned accounts, building trust and rapport while identifying areas of opportunity, highlighting best practices, and documenting them Review the customer journey, identifying how it’s supported, taking a consultative approach in helping clients overcome issues and achieve goals Facilitate interaction and workflow between project team members, including third-party service providers, to ensure deliverables are on time Collaborate, problem solve, and/or strategize upcoming client meetings with team members Work with the sales, professional services, to drive customer references and develop case studies Requirements I’ve already done that or have that! Minimum of 8 years’ experience in related role; 3-5 years of experience using and/or deploying IT Infrastructure / APM Monitoring/Observability/Event Management tools Used and or deployed monitoring/observability tools with more than one company and/or customers Strong understanding of IT Operations/NOCs/Command Centers, Infrastructure Operations, Application Development, DevOps processes Well-versed in the ITIL Incident Management Process Experience monitoring full-stack cloud, hybrid, and traditional on-premise systems including server OS’, storage, middleware, network, container systems, mobile and application software. Experience monitoring metrics, logs, and traces Analytical and process-oriented mindset Comfortable working across multiple departments in a deadline-driven environment Active team player, self-starter, and multitasker who can quickly adjust priorities Embraces Team Collaboration with customer success, pre-sales, renewals, partners, and services. Ability to understand customer outcomes that will drive measurable value that creates documented success. Help drive outcomes customers are looking for. Drives adoption and lifetime value by aligning solutions to high priority customer initiatives, adoption, value realization, and ultimately high customer satisfaction Preferred Qualifications Strong communications, customer success/ account management experience Knowledge of Gainsight and/or similar Customer Success Management tools Experience with Digital Experience Monitoring (synthetics monitoring, real user monitoring) For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus or commission and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $120,000 - 165,000 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), New York (excludes NYC Metro Area), and all other states. Base Pay Range $114,000 - 156,750 per year

Splunk is growing rapidly worldwide — we’re hiring self-starters who want to help top companies take on huge challenges by Turning Data into Doing. At Splunk, your skills won’t go stale. Work with people you like while building, selling, and supporting products people love. As a Sales Engineer for Splunk’s Observability, or “O11y” for short, you will be part of a world-class pre-sales team. You provide technical expertise and thought leadership on application-focused solutions to the sales organization and to Splunk’s prospects and customers. A Day in the Life of a Splunk O11y Sales Engineer You focus on customers while acting as the authority across your O11y solutions including the Observability, Splunk On-Call, and other Splunk technology products. You will consistently be delivering product demonstrations that directly address customer pain and emphasize our outstanding value proposition. You enjoy the opportunity to work directly with your Product Management, Engineering, Customer Success, and Marketing teams to share your knowledge and experiences to ultimately improve our business and our customers’ success. You succeed at working with all levels of an organization from the C-suite down to individual developers and SRE’s. You love the idea of guiding prospects through trials and POCs, demonstrating Splunk’s ability to meet and exceed customer requirements, and building a positive relationship that will go beyond the initial transaction and provide value to our customers for years to come. What you bring We can guide you on the technology, help you with soft skills, and educate you on processes. You bring a strong sense of self-motivation and an unbridled curiosity about what “is possible” with technology, the desire to work with an exciting team, and a positive, fun-loving demeanor. 7+ years’ experience in customer-facing roles. Sales roles are a power-up. 3+ years’ experience working in engineering/software development roles working with current programming languages including Java, Python, PHP, .NET, Ruby, Node.js, Go, etc. Experience selling and working with pure SaaS solutions in multi-tenant architectures. Hands-on experience working with containers or microservices on the AWS, GCP, and Microsoft Azure platforms where you are certified or eager to become certified. Familiarity with various monitoring tools like AppDynamics, Datadog, New Relic, and Grafana, is a real advantage in this role. Be prepared to discuss this. Potential travel is approximately 25%, focused primarily in the region. Are you looking for a marvelous place to work that celebrates innovation, leadership, and creativity? Please contact us. Splunk offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits including wellness programs, bonus programs, and company rest days. When you join Splunk you'll be working with a team of smart people who are as passionate about our products as we are about our customers' success. Splunk is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. Splunk will take the steps to assure that people are provided with reasonable accommodations as requested, during the interview process. For positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus or commission and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $138,000 - 189,750 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), New York (excludes NYC Metro Area), and all other states. Base Pay Range $132,000 - 181,500 per year

Role As a Partner Engineer, your mission is to drive Splunk’s adoption by empowering our global strategic partners to serve our mutual customers better. To that end, you will be responsible for integrating partner technologies with Splunk’s portfolio of solutions which support sales plays and marketing campaigns. You will collaborate with multiple teams in Splunk and the partner ecosystem. You must be able to engage at a technical level to assist with architecture and development initiatives. At times you may be the core developer for a Splunk integration and at times you may be responsible for validation of a solution or product architecture. Long term relationship management with our partners will make you effective in helping them develop viable solutions from which our mutual customers may benefit. A key component to this role is articulating and demonstrating Splunk’s mission statement To make machine data valuable, accessible, and usable by everyone. A strong knowledge of security, application management, and IT Operations is a necessity. You should be comfortable discussing issues of scale and fostering innovation in a dynamic technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base. You must possess strong presentation skills and be able to communicate clearly and professionally both verbally and in writing. A successful partner engineer will not only develop and maintain solutions but extend personal knowledge related to evolving and newly-emerging technologies underpinning the latest industry trends and apply them to build more pragmatic solutions. Responsibilities Help define partner integration strategies to enhance Splunk’s market position Own and drive technical aspects for partner related projects and collateral Work with product management, engineering, marketing, field sales, and corporate product development to identify prospective partners to augment Splunk’s offerings Develop and support Splunk integrations such as Apps or Add-ons Evaluate prospective partners for technical and business fit with Splunk’s strategy Evangelize and demonstrate Splunk solutions to partners Help partners create prototypes of technical solutions, support them in their development, and review the quality of their solutions Help partners, customers, and Splunk field sales with understanding and implementation of partner solutions Promote and describe Splunk’s ecosystem by posting blogs; speaking at conferences; and meeting with industry experts, partners, and Splunk customers and prospects Requirements Bachelor's degree in an engineering discipline (e.g., computer science, electrical engineering, information systems, or similar) -- exceptionally well-qualified candidates with equivalent experience will be considered 2-3 years of hands-on experience in web or application development. In-depth understanding of web technologies (such as HTTP, HTML/DOM, CSS, JavaScript, React/Node) and concepts like Web Services, SOA, REST APIs, and familiarity with an object-oriented programming language like Python or Java is strongly preferred Possess hands-on, working-level expertise in Amazon Web Services (AWS), Azure, and/or Google Cloud Platform to serve as a trusted adviser to our partners. Professional certifications are a plus Experience working with large-scale enterprises and complex technical environments; preferably related to the Splunk Platform Familiarity with products, companies, and solutions in Security and/or IT marketplace is desirable General knowledge of security, networking, server, database, and enterprise applications Self-motivated and self-educating, but willing to collaborate with partners and fellow Splunkers Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus or commission and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Bas e Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $129,600 - 178,200 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), New York (excludes NYC Metro Area), and all other states. Base Pay Range $121,600 - 167,200 per year We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
