jobTitle: Senior / Staff Technical Trainer, Enablement (AMER remote)
jobDescription: We are looking for a dynamic and creative Senior Technical Field Enablement Instructor to join the team and help us deliver world class training to our employees, partners, and customers nationally and worldwide. In this role you will perform instructional delivery of approved course materials with a focus on enabling Professional Services Consultants for our employees and partners. Candidates must have the ability to work within a team, have strong self-discipline, and be able to work independently. You will deliver classes virtually as well as sometimes at Splunk, partner, customer, and contract facilities. The mix of virtual vs on-site instruction is currently heavily weighted to virtual, but this may change in the future. Responsibilities I want to and can do that! Teaches advanced technical enablement and customer focused classes. Manages multiple projects/tasks with minimal supervision. Consistently meets or exceeds goals and/or project milestones Communicates effectively, both verbally and written, with management, team members, and other departments Anticipates and resolves common problems. Balances long and short-term goals by prioritizing activities. Actively participates in curriculum planning sessions for new product training where required.--Reviews training curriculum and provides feedback to instructional designers Adapts well to changing job and project requirements\ Recommends and implements solutions when project issues arise. Requirements I have already done that! Qualified candidates must have excellent oral presentation and customer interaction skills. Ability to deliver training in English. Has the ability to create productive and safe learning environments. Possesses the ability to hold balanced discussion with different types of class attendee, with varying experiencelevels, especially where differences of opinions arise. Demonstrates experience in training various technical audiences (i.e., consultants, software engineers, systemsadministrators, developers, sales engineers etc.) Technical and troubleshooting skills in at least one software application or technology. Experience with both the Linux and Windows operating systems; comfortable on the command line interface--A good understanding of basic Linux admin OS tasks like understanding and modifying file permissions, creating startup services & investigating running processes. Must be willing to travel up to 50% (may be significantly less than that initially). Must have or be able to obtain a current passport and be able to travel to other countries and regions without restriction. Capable of teaching intensive 5 business day boot camps. Hands on experience using, administering & architecting the Splunk platform, desirably in large scale deployments. Professional Services consultancy experience in Splunk and/or other technologies. Can speak a second language. CSIPP (Certified Security Specialist). Understanding of container orchestration technology. Experience with Splunk Enterprise Security or ITSI. Experience with Splunk-Phantom (Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR)) a plus. History in working in IT systems and/or Security monitoring. BA/BS degree or equivalent experience in a technical or related field Nice to Have Hold the Splunk Enterprise Certified Architect certification. Hold the Splunk Core Certified Consultant certification. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $ 152,000 - 209,000 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $ 142,400 - 195,800 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $ 129,600 - 178,200 per year

jobTitle: Senior Technical Course Developer (Observability) - Remote U.S.
jobDescription: At Splunk, we know that effective education is key to our success. Are you a skilled individual with experience developing curriculum on deep technical topics with knowledge of performance monitoring? We are looking for a Senior Technical Curriculum Developer who quickly masters advanced technical subjects and can craft instructional content and labs that are concise, accurate and outcome-based. You will build courseware for different delivery modes and audiences (customers, partners, employees) for our Observability Cloud product. If you have the required background, we'd love to hear from you. Openness, flexibility, creativity, passion and a sense of humor are highly valued here. Primary Responsibilities Designs, develops and maintains exceptional technical content for different learning experiences (including ILT, eLearning, labs, scenarios, simulations and assessments) Scopes projects and estimates time required accurately; consistently meets deadlines and communicates promptly when obstacles arise Engages and interviews subject matter experts for needs analysis; uses subject matter expert time efficiently Works with stakeholders to perform skill gap assessments and build training content to address those gaps Ensures learning and performance objectives are appropriate to the audience and that the training materials meet these objectives Works on multiple projects concurrently, monitors activity, progress, and time related to project development Interacts and collaborates with cross-functional groups; cultivates and maintains relationships with colleagues across organizations Leads the train-the-trainer sessions for instructor-led courses that you develop Continuously learns, collaborates efficiently, shares knowledge, and is able to cover new and temporary projects when needed Develops accreditation and / or certification exam questions and answers used to test the student mastery of the subject matter Mentors new team members and provides guidance Basic Qualifications At least five years of hands-on technical curriculum development experience creating commercial technical courseware (all modalities) and building lab environments Experience with elearning tools such as Articulate/Rise, Captivate, ScreenflowPro, Camtasia Experience with distributed software systems, microservices applications/deployments, security technologies, Cloud technologies, Linux OS, Linux command line; AWS EC2 or similar cloud computing platform Strong technical background; able to understand and explain highly technical subject matter Ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment with continuously evolving requirements Excellent time management skills with the ability to coordinate and prioritize effectively High aptitude for managing and solving conflicting issues Outstanding negotiator, innovator, diversity advocate, and relationship-builder Preferred Qualifications Five years of familiarity with infrastructure, network or application performance monitoring tools Experience crafting courses for Software as a Service (SaaS) products Programming experience in Python, Java, JavaScript, GO, .NET a plus For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $ 124,000 - 170,500 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $ 116,000 - 159,500 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $ 104,800 - 144,100 per year

At Splunk, we know that effective education is key to our continued success. Are you experienced in developing curriculum on deep technical topics with knowledge of enterprise cloud services, security, or observability solutions? We are looking for a Technical Curriculum Developer who quickly masters advanced technical subjects and can craft instructional materials and labs that are concise, accurate, and outcome based. If you have the required background, we'd love to hear from you. Openness, flexibility, creativity, passion, and a sense of humor are highly valued here. Responsibilities I want to and can do that! Designs and develops exceptional technical course content and lab exercises for instructor presentation or self-paced learning Scopes projects and estimates time required accurately; consistently meets deadlines and communicates promptly when obstacles arise Manages multiple concurrent projects and consults widely across organizations to determine objectives; researches topics independently using all available resources Works with internal stakeholders to perform skill gap assessments and build training content to address those gaps Ensures learning and performance objectives are tailored to the audience and that the training materials meet performance objectives Uses subject matter expert time efficiently; builds collaborative relationships with colleagues across organizations Works on multiple projects concurrently, monitors activity, progress, and time related to project development Develops hands-on labs, data generators, and grading applications; builds and maintains lab server environments Learns quickly, collaborates efficiently, shares knowledge, and is happy to cover new and temporary projects when needed Requirements I’ve already done that or have that! Strong technical background; able to understand and explain highly technical subject matter 3+ years of software/technology experience 2+ years of hands-on experience developing commercial technical courseware (self-paced and instructor-led) and building lab environments Experience with enterprise SaaS products, familiar with data collection and analysis tools Experience with at least one e-Learning tool such as Camtasia, Captivate, or Articulate 360 products Outstanding problem solver, negotiator, innovator, diversity advocate, and relationship builder Excellent time management skills with the ability to coordinate and prioritize effectively High aptitude for managing and solving tactical issues Proven communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills Ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment with continuously evolving requirements A big plus if you have Experience with Linux and/or Windows OS commands Experience with Python, JavaScript, bash scripts, and/or REST API Experience with distributed software systems, microservices applications/deployments, and/or cloud technologies Experience with AWS or similar cloud computing platform Experience building clustered lab environments and/or lab environments using containers Education Got it! Minimum of a Bachelor's degree

Designs and develops exceptional technical course content and lab exercises for instructor presentation or self-paced learning Scopes projects and estimates time required accurately; consistently meets deadlines and communicates promptly when obstacles arise Manages multiple concurrent projects and consults widely across organizations to determine objectives; researches topics independently using all available resources Works with internal stakeholders to perform skill gap assessments and build training content to address those gaps Ensures learning and performance objectives are tailored to the audience and that the training materials meet performance objectives Uses subject matter expert time efficiently; builds collaborative relationships with colleagues across organizations Works on multiple projects concurrently, monitors activity, progress, and time related to project development Develops hands-on labs, data generators, and grading applications; builds and maintains lab server environments Learns quickly, collaborates efficiently, shares knowledge, and is happy to cover new and temporary projects when needed Requirements I’ve already done that or have that! Strong technical background; able to understand and explain highly technical subject matter 3+ years of software/technology experience 2+ years of hands-on experience developing commercial technical courseware (self-paced and instructor-led) and building lab environments Experience with enterprise SaaS products, familiar with data collection and analysis tools Experience with at least one e-Learning tool such as Camtasia, Captivate, or Articulate 360 products Outstanding problem solver, negotiator, innovator, diversity advocate, and relationship builder Excellent time management skills with the ability to coordinate and prioritize effectively High aptitude for managing and solving tactical issues Proven communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills Ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment with continuously evolving requirements A big plus if you have Experience with Linux and/or Windows OS commands Experience with Python, JavaScript, bash scripts, and/or REST API Experience with distributed software systems, microservices applications/deployments, and/or cloud technologies Experience with AWS or similar cloud computing platform Experience building clustered lab environments and/or lab environments using containers Education Got it! Minimum of a Bachelor's degree

Join us as we pursue our vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun, and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our story! Join us as we pursue our vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun, and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our story! Are you an undergraduate or graduate student interested in learning the day-to-day realities of web marketing and SEO? Are you seeking to learn from an innovative, expert, and data driven team? If so, this intern role could be right for you! Splunk is looking for an SEO intern to support our demand generation focused SEO team. This role will assist in researching, creating, editing, publishing, and analyzing web content crafted to rank for high-value keywords on search engines like Google. Role The Splunk internship program runs for a minimum of 10 weeks, up to a maximum of 12 consecutive weeks with start dates between May and June 2023. Applicants should be available to participate full-time (40 hours/week) in an internship during this time. Responsibilities (What We Hope You’ll Learn!) Help conduct keyword research to find opportunities for new website content Get hands-on in our primary CMS, Adobe Experience Manager, to make edits and publish new content Research and create blog posts and other content Update and refresh existing web content Learn and apply best-in-class SEO processes to ensure content succeeds in Organic/Natural Search Skill Requirements Experience with research, writing, and editing about a variety of Tech and IT related topics - similar to a research report. Interest in learning about websites, basic HTML, how to use a Content Management System and common SEO tools, how SEO and web marketing works. Ability to handle multiple projects and priorities, timely and efficiently, in a fast-paced environment. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Interest or experience in Tech and IT topics is a bonus but not required. Education Requirements Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s in English, Business, Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or a related field, with a strong record of academic achievement. Graduation date of December 2023 or later. We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey. Service Readiness and Planning Manager The Service Readiness and Planning Manager (SRPM) assumes responsibility for ensuring Service is enabled throughout the Product Lifecycle, from the product Concept stage until the End of Life. SRPMs represent the Services organization in Splunk Product Development Methodology where SRPMs partner closely with engineering teams to understand the product roadmap and prepare the respective Services Technology organizations for General Availability/Commercial Availability of the Product. The Service Readiness and Planning Manager (SRPM) is responsible to communicate to Splunk customers and internal stakeholders Splunk’s product issues that may impact their business and provide them Engineering’s solutions to prevent business disruption. What You’ll Do… Develop and deliver the service readiness delivery strategy and plan for each new product, solution, and service for each phase of the development cycle. Work closely with Product Management, Global Support Centers, Support Operations, and NPI Training, Third Party Vendor Management, and Support Lab Operations to design and implement the plan for launch or GA/CA. Ensure the Product Management and the Services teams collaborate during the development of new products and align service strategy with the product/solution to the go-to-market strategy Engage early in conversations with Engineering teams to define workflows and design decisions which will best meet our customers' needs, with a focus on ease-of-use, simplicity, clarity. Voice in the conversation to advocate for support team and customer needs in new product launches. Ensure that defined troubleshooting workflows, technical training, and tools exist in conjunction with product launches or changes. Drive teamwork and collaboration decision making with Engineering, and Customer Experience teams to determine the best approach to address the customer needs affected by a known defect. Help our PM team understand top ticket drivers in monthly Customer Sync/ Business reviews. Analyze metrics and friction areas around support tickets to determine top areas for improvement with our ability to support customers. Develop recommendations for product improvement based on support issues and customer feedback. Identify opportunities for our TSEs to receive deep technical training for new product launches. Work with various teammates at Splunk to build long-lasting relationships with our customers and deliver experiences unique to our industry. Partner with leaders in CS, Eng., PM, and across the company to streamline communication between our teams. Skills You Have… 4-5 years’ experience in a customer-facing product support role In-depth understanding of technical support and customer service methodologies Robust written and verbal communication skills, and a keen capability to tailor your messages to a wide variety of audiences Fundamental or methodical problem solver Strong attention to detail and ability to derive patterns from bulk data Ability to concisely communicate team needs to business leaders and partners Multi-tasks and handles stress with ease, without getting flustered Can empathize with customers and team members without absorbing or communicating negativity Proactive, upbeat, concise, patient and customer-centric Loves to and excels at translating “customer-speak” to “developer-speak” and vice-versa Willing to continue learning Encourages & adapts to change in a swiftly paced workplace Understanding of Principle web and security technologies (SOAR, SIEM, Threat Intelligence) Windows OS administration experience [Active Directory] Cross-platform OS knowledge [Linux, Mac OS X, Windows] Cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure or GCP. Nice to Haves Bachelor’s Degree [Computer Science, Information Systems or related] Previous project management experience Experience supporting a high-availability SaaS environment Familiar with enterprise-level Data platform technologies [Elastic, SumoLogic etc..] Previous experience with customer support or help desk issue tracking tools Experience with bug tracking software [Phabricator, GitLab, Jira, etc. ] You should apply if you… Care about contributing to an amazing work culture and environment Are comfortable navigating a fast-paced role that is constantly iterating Prefer trying and failing to getting it flawless the first time Are Passionate About Service & Creating Long-term Customer Relationships Have impeccable communication - both verbal and written This job may not be for you if... Working for a company where change is a constant isn’t something you are ready to embrace If you prefer to work on your own (we're a team that pushes each other and learns together) We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $ 124,000 - 170,500 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $ 116,000 - 159,500 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $ 104,800 - 144,100 per year

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey. Service Readiness and Planning Manager The Service Readiness and Planning Manager (SRPM) assumes responsibility for ensuring Service is enabled throughout the Product Lifecycle, from the product Concept stage until the End of Life. SRPMs represent the Services organization in Splunk Product Development Methodology where SRPMs partner closely with engineering teams to understand the product roadmap and prepare the respective Services Technology organizations for General Availability/Commercial Availability of the Product. The Service Readiness and Planning Manager (SRPM) is responsible to communicate to Splunk customers and internal stakeholders Splunk’s product issues that may impact their business and provide them Engineering’s solutions to prevent business disruption. What You’ll Do… Develop and deliver the service readiness delivery strategy and plan for each new product, solution, and service for each phase of the development cycle. Work closely with Product Management, Global Support Centers, Support Operations, and NPI Training, Third Party Vendor Management, and Support Lab Operations to design and implement the plan for launch or GA/CA. Ensure the Product Management and the Services teams collaborate during the development of new products and align service strategy with the product/solution to the go-to-market strategy Engage early in conversations with Engineering teams to define workflows and design decisions which will best meet our customers' needs, with a focus on ease-of-use, simplicity, clarity. Voice in the conversation to advocate for support team and customer needs in new product launches. Ensure that defined troubleshooting workflows, technical training, and tools exist in conjunction with product launches or changes. Drive teamwork and collaboration decision making with Engineering, and Customer Experience teams to determine the best approach to address the customer needs affected by a known defect. Help our PM team understand top ticket drivers in monthly Customer Sync/ Business reviews. Analyze metrics and friction areas around support tickets to determine top areas for improvement with our ability to support customers. Develop recommendations for product improvement based on support issues and customer feedback. Identify opportunities for our TSEs to receive deep technical training for new product launches. Work with various teammates at Splunk to build long-lasting relationships with our customers and deliver experiences unique to our industry. Partner with leaders in CS, Eng., PM, and across the company to streamline communication between our teams. Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Role The Regional Services Sales Leader is responsible for creating and building out a Professional Services Sales region. Are you someone who can execute against a plan to deliver customer success and meet and exceed financial targets? Can you work cross functionally, selling Services offerings, rapidly growing adoption of Splunk products, offerings and use cases into new market areas and our customers’ ecosystems? If the answer to these questions is yes and you bring a real passion for building a positive customer experience, then please read on. Responsibilities You will be responsible for the Service Sales region which will include achieving Professional Services and Education Services bookings targets. Position and sell services to deliver customer outcomes and drive customer adoption of Splunk products and services. Effectively communicate the Services strategy, goals, objectives and results to customers and internal license teams and partners Craft account plans for continued growth of the Services business and maintain continuous alignment with the Sales Organization. Drive Professional Services attach rate for the team In this role you will work closely with your license Sales team counterparts and participate in QBR’s and forecast meetings to get results. Establish relationships at the C-level of the largest partners and customers in the region. Work hand-in-hand with Splunk account teams and partners nationally on large opportunities, helping to position service delivery and best practices to deliver security solutions.Requirements 10+ years of experience in Sales within a software company Experience in landing key initiatives, education of offerings and services and sales process Experienced in various sales methodologies and complex sales training (eg. Spin, Challenger, Miller-Hyman, etc.) Quantifiable sales success and expertise in selling services related products and solutions to customers, with track record of consistently meeting/exceeding sales quotas. History of building/growing a successful Services sales team that Splunk can use to scale this team when needed. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Business or relevant technical field experience. (Bonus points will be given for MBA or Masters' Degrees). Knowledge of what it takes to build a scalable Services Sales model in a fast-growing environment. Experience with regularly used tools – Salesforce and Tableau. Splunk products experience is a PLUS. Travel is required up to 60%, possibly more at peak times. We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus or commission and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $169,000 - 232,375 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), New York (excludes NYC Metro Area), and all other states. Base Pay Range $158,600 - 218,075 per year

Position and sell services to deliver customer outcomes and drive customer adoption of Splunk products and services. Effectively communicate the Services strategy, goals, objectives and results to customers and internal license teams and partners Craft account plans for continued growth of the Services business and maintain continuous alignment with the Sales Organization. Drive Professional Services attach rate for the team In this role you will work closely with your license Sales team counterparts and participate in QBR’s and forecast meetings to get results. Establish relationships at the C-level of the largest partners and customers in the region. Work hand-in-hand with Splunk account teams and partners nationally on large opportunities, helping to position service delivery and best practices to deliver security solutions.Requirements 10+ years of experience in Sales within a software company Experience in landing key initiatives, education of offerings and services and sales process Experienced in various sales methodologies and complex sales training (eg. (Bonus points will be given for MBA or Masters' Degrees). Knowledge of what it takes to build a scalable Services Sales model in a fast-growing environment. Experience with regularly used tools – Salesforce and Tableau. Splunk products experience is a PLUS. Travel is required up to 60%, possibly more at peak times. We value diversity at our company. jobTitle: Software Engineer in Test - Data Platform S&I
jobDescription: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! About The Role Splunk Data Platform team is seeking an exceptional Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET), to support and test both back-end and front-end of our platform offerings. Our team is responsible for testing various components and services of Splunk for both on-premise and Splunk Cloud Offerings. You will partner with the Engineering and Product team to design, develop and execute sophisticated tests to ensure the end-to-end quality of Data Platform features. We are looking for motivated, enthusiastic and focused individuals who have a real passion for quality engineering and have strong knowledge of product quality standards, automation and processes. Responsibilities Identify Testing Requirements Work closely with developers and product managers to understand and clarify testing requirements against product specifications and implementations Test planning and design Design the test plan and test cases for complex features in large distributed environments for Splunk Enterprise Cloud product line Design, build and maintain test automation Develop reliable test automation in Python, Java or Golang with high-code quality, and conduct peer code reviews Analytical Mind Conduct in-depth analysis to identify the testing gaps and improve overall test coverage Continuous Optimization Identify gaps in test practices/framework/tooling, and design/drive solutions for higher efficiencies across the organizational boundaries Customer Obsession Incorporate the feedback from customer use cases, customer issues, telemetry data in to testing practices to enhance the overall product quality Mentor Coach junior team members and participate in hiring critical talents for the teamRequirements Passionate at SDET engineering and Splunk Expertise on test-driven development, developing different levels of automated tests, such as unit test, functional test, integration test, system test, or performance test 3+ years experience developing test automation in Python, Java or Golang Experience in developing and evolving test frameworks (like Pytest, Junit, TestNG, or any Go testing frameworks), tools, infrastructure, and CI systems (like Jenkins, Bamboo, etc.) Experience in setting up and working on Cloud distributed systems and solutions like AWS Cloud, GCP, or Azure Effective communication and strong collaboration skills Knowledge on microservices. Prior testing experience for microservices based products is a plus Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and any container orchestration is a plus Experience with Hadoop, Spark, or Hive is a plusEducation BS EE or CS degree; 5 + years related experience (or Masters and 3 + years related experience or Ph.D. and 0 years experience) or equivalent. We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range $ 110,400 - 151,800 per year

jobTitle: Software Engineer Intern (Frontend) - Summer 2023, Remote Available
jobDescription: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Role Splunk is looking for interns for Summer 2023! As a Frontend Software Engineer intern , you will work on a real project (or a few) and have an opportunity to enjoy our dynamic, startup-like environment. You will experience Splunking and what defines our culture while honing the skills which separate our development teams from others. Working to support internal and external customer needs, you will collaborate with multi-functional teams, receive mentorship, and gain insight into our values-driven process. Our goal is both to support your growth and development while empowering you for a successful start to your career. You will get to work with smart and hardworking individuals who are doing state of the art development work (native mobile, web front-end and back-end, DevOps) in areas of machine learning, data analytics, infrastructure and event correlations across silos to build best-in-class business analytics software. You will be interacting with product management and customers to understand detailed requirements. You will also work with other engineering teams across Splunk to design and build high-performance solutions. You will have the opportunity to Design, develop, code and test software systems, or applications for software improvements and new products. Build innovative solutions that enable rapid development. Contribute through participation in agile development of project timelines, implementation design specifications, system flow diagrams, documentation, testing, and ongoing support of systems. Make an impact through your recommended modifications to processes and procedures, and directly contribute to standard methodologies, architecture, and implementation. Basic Requirements Actively pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field, and a strong record of academic achievement. Applicants should have a minimum of one quarter/semester remaining in their studies after their internship concludes. The Splunk internship program runs for a minimum of 10 weeks, up to a maximum of 12 consecutive weeks with start dates between May and June 2023. Applicants should be available to participate full-time (40 hours/week) in an internship during this time. Preferred Requirements Strong interest in front-end/UI development Familiarity with frontend JavaScript technologies including React/Redux, (nice to have Typescript, jQuery, Backbone) Exposure to styling web applications using CSS Experience with modern version control system, such as Git Exposure to test automation, such as Karma, Mocha, Jest, Storybook, etc Understanding of CI/CD Experience building meaningful software applications in a class, as a personal hobby, as a job, as part of an open source project Exposure to Agile development Experience collaborating with others in a fast-paced environment Strong communication skills, verbal and written Ability to learn new technologies quickly What We Offer You A fun and collaborative environment with many exciting events from interacting with other interns to conversations with our executive leadership team. A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies. A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support. Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation. A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment. We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for benefits. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro and New York City Metro Area Base Pay $38.00 per hour California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay $36.00 per hour All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay $34.00 per hour

At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk Splunk is hiring a PMO Solution Analyst - PMO Systems & Processes, reporting to the Director of Portfolio Operations on the Planning & Execution team within Go To Market Operations (GTMO). In this role, you will be responsible for defining and developing a range of technology systems, processes and tools to support the management and reporting of programs in the GTMO portfolio. Working closely with the Director and the Portfolio Operations team, this role will extract requirements and define a flexible solution architecture, product roadmap and process framework that will support a broad range of PMO process, system and tool related needs. The successful candidate will have a background in Program/Project Management, Program Control/Compliance, and PPM Tools and will leverage experience, best practices, and relationships with program teams and key stakeholders to deliver on the organizational objectives and key results. Key Responsibilities Work with internal business representatives, program managers, technical delivery teams, and change management to understand requirements, short term priorities, and the longer-term roadmap. Review and assess existing internal capabilities, as well as available third-party products and determine the best approach to support user requirements. Understand the implications of technical decisions and process changes and be able to explain these to users and stakeholders. Support development of internal technologies and/or the implementation and configuration of off-the-shelf products, including enhancements/upgrades to scale existing systems. Act as the subject matter expert & technical authority for internal program delivery teams. Facilitate the launch, adoption and in-life support of PMO processes, tools and technology, including through development of tool and process specific training. Provide strategic advice to delivery teams to ensure the right tool is deployed at the right time in the right way. Facilitate non-technical business improvements and transformation, such as business process improvement, process standardization and business operating & engagement models. Maintain and evolve the Project Delivery Lifecycle (PDLC) process. Support portfolio management and analysis by building mechanisms to help drive execution rigor and compliance. Develop & enable executive level status reports and dashboards. Requirements Demonstrated experience utilizing and managing PMO /PPM systems and tools (Smartsheet, JIRA, etc.) integrated solutions (Tableau, Salesforce, etc.) with high levels of knowledge in project management methodology and processes (Agile, Lean Six Sigma, etc.) Strong interpersonal skills, experience working with a broad range of stakeholders in a global organization Proven track record of defining and delivering broad technical and non-technical solutions covering all facets of PMO, portfolio management, and delivery excellence Bachelor’s Degree 3-5 years of experience

At Splunk, we know that effective education is key to our success. Are you a skilled individual with experience developing curriculum on deep technical topics? We are looking for a Technical Curriculum Developer who quickly masters advanced technical subjects and can craft instructional content and labs that are concise, accurate and outcome-based. You will build courseware for different delivery modes and audiences (customers, partners, employees) for Splunk products. If you have the required background, we'd love to hear from you. Openness, flexibility, creativity, passion and a sense of humor are highly valued here. Primary Responsibilities Designs, develops and maintains exceptional technical content for different learning experiences (including ILT, eLearning, labs, scenarios, simulations and assessments) Scopes projects and estimates time required accurately; consistently meets deadlines and communicates promptly when obstacles arise Engages and interviews subject matter experts for needs analysis; uses subject matter expert time efficiently Works with stakeholders to perform skill gap assessments and build training content to address those gaps Ensures learning and performance objectives are appropriate to the audience and that the training materials meet these objectives Works on multiple projects concurrently, monitors activity, progress, and time related to project development Interacts and collaborates with cross-functional groups; cultivates and maintains relationships with colleagues across organizations Leads the train-the-trainer sessions for instructor-led courses that you develop Continuously learns, collaborates efficiently, shares knowledge, and is able to cover new and temporary projects when needed Develops accreditation and / or certification exam questions and answers used to test the student mastery of the subject matter Mentors new team members and provides guidance Basic Qualifications 5+ years of hands-on technical curriculum development experience creating commercial technical courseware (all modalities) and building lab environments Experience with distributed software systems, microservices applications/deployments, security technologies, Cloud technologies, Linux OS, Linux command line; AWS EC2 or similar cloud computing platform Experience with elearning tools such as Articulate/Rise, Captivate, ScreenFlow, Camtasia Strong technical background; able to understand and explain highly technical subject matter Ability to meet tight deadlines in an environment with continuously evolving requirements Excellent time management skills with the ability to coordinate and prioritize effectively High aptitude for managing and solving conflicting issues Outstanding negotiator, innovator, diversity advocate, and relationship-builder Preferred Qualifications In-depth knowledge and experience with Splunk products Experience crafting courses for Software as a Service (SaaS) products Programming experience in Python, Java, JavaScript, GO, .NET a plus We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $ 124,000 - 170,500 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $116,000 - 159,500 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $104,800 - 144,100 per year

jobTitle: Sr. Data Engineer - GTM (Remote in US)
jobDescription: Ready to shake things up? Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and strive to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun, and most meaningfully to each other’s success. We continue to be on a tear while enjoying incredible growth year over year. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! The Senior Data Engineer will be involved in building data pipelines at a large scale to enable business teams to work with data and analyze metrics that support and drive the business. You will partner with cross functional teams to identify opportunities and continuously develop and improve processes for efficiency. The team is looking for a Senior Data Engineer who can architect and build solutions across multiple data sources to deliver metrics/reporting use cases. This position is responsible to build and scale the data platform that works to provide business analytics. The role involves ownership and technical delivery, working closely with other members (BI engineer and infrastructure teams). Strong technical experience within enterprise software is essential. Responsibilities Responsible for developing and supporting data pipelines that support and enable the overall strategy of expanded data programs, services, process optimization and advanced business intelligence Leading data discovery sessions with business teams, comprising product owners, data analysts, and cross-team technologists to understand enterprise data requirements of analytics projects Partner with business domain experts, system analysts, data/application architects, and development teams to ensure data design is aligned with business strategy and direction Identify and document standard methodologies, standards, and architecture guidelines Dive deep, as required, to assist Business Intelligence Engineers through technical hurdles impacting delivery Required Qualifications, Skills & Experience 7+ years of data architecture related experience such as data analysis, data modeling, and data integration. Experience with GTM and Marketing business processes and applications Good understanding of Web Marketing Technologies, use of APIs to integrate and bring data from external marketing data sources, troubleshoot issues and take actions based on API documentation Experience in custom ETL design, implementation, and maintenance Knowledge of programming languages (e.g. Python and Object Oriented Programming) Hands-on experience with SQL database design Experience working on CI/CD processes and source control tools such as Github and GitLab Experience working Snowflake and relational databases Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle cloud enterprise data warehousing (EDW) implementations like Snowflake Strong knowledge and experience with Agile/Scrum methodology and iterative practices in a service delivery lifecycle Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to influence a large organization Passionate about data solutions, technologies, and frameworks Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $156,000 - 214,500 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $146,400 - 201,300 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $132,800 - 182,600 per year We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

The role involves ownership and technical delivery, working closely with other members (BI engineer and infrastructure teams). Strong technical experience within enterprise software is essential. Responsibilities Responsible for developing and supporting data pipelines that support and enable the overall strategy of expanded data programs, services, process optimization and advanced business intelligence Leading data discovery sessions with business teams, comprising product owners, data analysts, and cross-team technologists to understand enterprise data requirements of analytics projects Partner with business domain experts, system analysts, data/application architects, and development teams to ensure data design is aligned with business strategy and direction Identify and document standard methodologies, standards, and architecture guidelines Dive deep, as required, to assist Business Intelligence Engineers through technical hurdles impacting delivery Required Qualifications, Skills & Experience 7+ years of data architecture related experience such as data analysis, data modeling, and data integration. Experience with GTM and Marketing business processes and applications Good understanding of Web Marketing Technologies, use of APIs to integrate and bring data from external marketing data sources, troubleshoot issues and take actions based on API documentation Experience in custom ETL design, implementation, and maintenance Knowledge of programming languages (e.g. Python and Object Oriented Programming) Hands-on experience with SQL database design Experience working on CI/CD processes and source control tools such as Github and GitLab Experience working Snowflake and relational databases Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle cloud enterprise data warehousing (EDW) implementations like Snowflake Strong knowledge and experience with Agile/Scrum methodology and iterative practices in a service delivery lifecycle Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to influence a large organization Passionate about data solutions, technologies, and frameworks Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Role Are you passionate about learning new technologies and understanding how they work? Are you interested in an opportunity to work with an upbeat team to help drive its products to a new level? In our journey to turn data into doing, We are looking for a seasoned, creative Sr. Engineering Manager, to help us focus on the scalability and performance of our products and build significant benchmarks that address customer use cases. At Splunk, we see tremendous demand in dealing with heterogeneous data in utmost volume, i.e. petabytes per day, each and every release of our software is highly scrutinized to meet the demands of our customers. As a Sr. Engineering Manager, Product Performance, you'll have a key role in our products' success. You will collaborate with peers, field teams, customers to understand and encapsulate the use cases into industry standard benchmarks. You will work with product management and reach out directly to our customers to get direct exposure to the usage patterns we strive to satisfy. You will also help drive the direction of product to meet the ever increasing demand of data in security and IT observability market Responsibilities You will lead a team of extraordinary, highly motivated software engineers who are responsible to make Splunk products performant, scalable and reliable. You will be responsible for providing performance insights and identify optimization opportunities to product stakeholders, triage production performance bottlenecks, and identify and fix performance issues while working with all engineering teams. Work with various product teams design and develop state-of-art solutions to existing performance problems, and performance analysis tools to allow dev teams to gain further insight into production behavior. Our goal is to enable self serviceable PSR testing and analysis, so we can scale the business in leaps and bounds You will help cultivate the engineering culture of owning performance, so every engineer knows that their code is accurately tested in an autonomous fashion as they deploy to each environment. In order to successfully lead this team, you will need exceptional leadership skills, familiarity with performance tools, proficiency with agile development methodologies, and the ability to operate within short release cycles. Own end-to-end performance coverage, identify bottlenecks and work with the Engineering teams to address issues. Encourage a data-driven culture to improve the performance, efficiency and scalability of services and systems to help scale the company. Daily management of objectives, priorities, trade offs, risk as well as performance management of all staff reporting to you. Provide technical leadership, career development, and mentoring to team members. Requirements 10+ years performance engineering experience with a distinguished track record of driving performance across a large team 7+ years management experience with demonstrated ability to attract, develop and retain talent. Strong technical skills in Big Data Platform and distributed computing system, micro service, cloud native performance. Domain knowledge in cloud computing. Skilled in both the art and science of benchmark creation and measurement and modeling of system behavior under load Ability to find root cause of performance bottlenecks with profiling tools, pstack, qmlprofiler Passionate to optimize the performance bottlenecks and improve the product Experience in taking on problems of load, scale, and optimizations of sophisticated large-scale deployments Expert in scripting languages (Python) and compiled languages (C/C++) Ability to empower people, instill accountability and achieve results. Agile, proactive, comfortable working with ambiguous specifications and can prioritize on the fly. Experience with enterprise software capacity planning a big plus Education Masters/Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Equivalent Experience We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $ 180,800 - 248,600 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $ 171,200 - 235,400 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $ 153,600 - 211,200 per year

jobTitle: Sr. Order Management Analyst- REMOTE US
jobDescription: About Us Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable, and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Role Sr. Order Management Analyst serves as a core business partner within the finance organization focused on the analysis of data from multiple sources and the development of scalable solutions to ensure accurate booking and reporting of revenue. As a key member of the Revenue Accounting team, the Sr. Order Management Analyst will be responsible for working with Sales, Revenue, Business Transformation, and other cross functional teams to streamline, automate and improve processes related to Order Management, Billing and Revenue. This position offers the ability to learn, develop and grow your career working for a dynamic and fast-growing public company Responsibilities Perform ad hoc, deep dive analysis specific to critical metrics and SLAs as needed to develop recommendations and impact the decision-making of the Revenue Operations team Prepare, review, and analyze various reporting data using Excel tools and functions (Pivot Tables, Macros, Vlookups, and other calculation functions) Lead special projects to drive improvements in process to minimize billing errors and streamline our key control reconciliations including defining business requirements and user acceptance testing Review and process sales order and sales contract information sources (order forms, agreements, POs, approvals) for completeness and accuracy in accordance to processing SLAs and booking policies Prepare, obtain approvals, and process RMA / rebill orders Support month-end and quarter-end close activities, with ability to work non-standard hours Work closely with OTC Transformation team to review and re-evaluate processes and procedures to enhance the effectiveness of the business operations to support increased growth and deal complexity Train and support Shared Services Requirements 5+ years of Order Management, Deal Desk, or Operations related experience, preferably in a software and or SaaS (Software-As-A-Service) sales organization Experience with SAP (S/4 Hanna - BRIM/Hybris Billing) required Experience with Salesforce.com and Google Suite is a plus. Advanced in Excel (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, Macros, Report Building, nested formulas, etc.) Education BS in Accounting or Finance or equivalent experience We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. jobTitle: Sr. Product Portfolio Manager - Security & Specializations
jobDescription: Job Title Sr. Product Portfolio Manager – Security & Specializations Join us as we pursue our ground-breaking new vision to make machine data accessible, usable, and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! Splunk is the world’s first Data-to-Everything Platform. Now organizations no longer need to worry about where their data is coming from, and they are free to focus on the business outcomes that data can deliver. Join Splunk and our Global Technical Enablement team! The mission of the Global Technical Enablement team is to enable the Splunk technical field and partners with knowledge and skills needed to effectively perform their roles and responsibilities. We are looking for an innovative and experienced Senior Product Portfolio Manager dedicated to the Splunk Security and Splunk products specializations. This position reports into the Global Director of Technical Enablement. Role To grow the demand for Splunk in the market through education and ensure customers, partners and Splunkers can effectively build their capability to deliver outcomes with Splunk, this role will ensure that the Splunk technical field organization (Sales Engineering, Professional Services, Customer Success Managers, and Technical Support), partner and customer ecosystem have the technical knowledge and skills needed. By demonstrating deep technical background and knowledge of the roles they perform and how to effectively enable them, this role will provide strategic vision and execute tactically to help us expand, evolve, modernize, and measure the impact of our technical enablement programs. This is a high-energy position in a global company that requires someone who is quick to pick up new skills and can work well with colleagues and customers in different geos, organizations, and teams. This role will drive our technical enablement with learning paths and specializations aligned to the corporate strategy lead with security, accelerate observability and extend the platform portfolio. Responsibilities Serve as first point of contact for technical enablement for cross-functional leaders within Splunk and our Partner network for our Splunk Security and Specialization learning paths. Define a holistic enablement strategy, process, and prioritized roadmap for the corresponding product areas – ensuring enablement programs, and specialization learning maps aligned to product roadmaps, launches, and incremental releases, stakeholder needs, business opportunity and goals. Build an operating framework of measures and KPI’s to demonstrate the execution and business impact of the enablement strategy Own the success and execution of technical enablement across phased activities (e.g., design, development, delivery, evaluation) and life cycle of relevance – from onboarding to continuous learning (e.g., quarterly enablement plans). Analyze business and learner performance metrics to inform enablement strategy and to continuously improve quality of content, format, and delivery worldwide Collaborate closely with others Product Portfolio Managers for Security, Observability and Platform for alignment and consistency. Become the expert of the end-to-end learning paths that include all products, and all personas, ensuring consistency learner experience, upskill of capabilities, and performance improvement. Participate in business/product group-aligned staff meetings and interlocks to gather enablement requirements and feedback and to present quarterly enablement business reviews Evangelize, communicate and market enablement programs and initiatives through learning maps, Slack, portal updates, newsletters, quarterly webcasts, etc.Requirements 5+ years of experience delivering and creating technical training programs at Enterprise/SaaS companies Understand the customer facing technical ecosystem including the diverse enablement needs of various functions like presales, delivery, support, and partners Knowledge of Splunk, monitoring, networking, and security; Enterprise software and Cloud technologies Proven ability to influence and closely partner with Product Management and Engineering to align product releases with content updates and technical enablement delivery Customer Success and Sales Engineering Field Leadership to ensure our programs are meeting the needs of our professional services, sales engineers, and technical support engineers. Subject Matter Experts and Content developers to create instructionally sound, engaging, and interactive technical enablement content Global Field Enablement team members who are creating sales enablement and product-based learning experiences Education and Certification teams for Accreditation and Learning Paths development Proven ability to work independently with a “make it happen” attitude; able to operate and execute in areas of uncertainty and ambiguity; problem solver and quick learner Experience with education technology such as learning management systems, sales enablement platforms, video services, content development tools, and virtual delivery platforms Education Bachelors' degree in a technical field. Note Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. The base pay for this position is dependent on work location as set out below, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for bonus and benefits, and may be eligible for equity. Base Pay Range SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area Base Pay Range $124,000 - 170,500 per year California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts Base Pay Range $116,000 - 159,500 per year All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area. Base Pay Range $104,800 - 144,100 per year We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
